description: Sort Python import definitions alphabetically within logical sections.

arguments.name: files
arguments.description: One or more Python source files that need their imports sorted.

options.name: --help
options.description: show this help message and exit

options.name: --version
options.description: Displays the currently installed version of isort.

options.name: --version-number
options.description: Returns just the current version number without the logo

options.name: --verbose
options.description: Shows verbose output...

options.name: --only-modified
options.description: Suppresses verbose output for non-modified files.

options.name: --dedup-headings
options.description: Tells isort to only show an identical custom import heading comment once...

options.name: --quiet
options.description: Shows extra quiet output, only errors are outputted.

options.name: --stdout
options.description: Force resulting output to stdout, instead of in-place.

options.name: --overwrite-in-place
options.description: Tells isort to overwrite in place using the same file handle...

options.name: --show-config
options.description: See isort's determined config, as well as sources of config options.

options.name: --show-files
options.description: See the files isort will be run against...

options.name: --diff
options.description: Prints a diff of all the changes isort would make...

options.name: --check-only
options.description: Checks the file for unsorted / unformatted imports...

options.name: --ignore-whitespace
options.description: Tells isort to ignore whitespace differences when --check-only is being used.

options.name: --settings-path
options.description: Explicitly set the settings path or file...

options.name: --config-root
options.description: Explicitly set the config root for resolving all configs...

options.name: --resolve-all-configs
options.description: Tells isort to resolve the configs for all sub-directories...

options.name: --profile
options.description: Base profile type to use for configuration (black, django, etc.).

options.name: --old-finders
options.description: Use the old deprecated finder logic...

options.name: --jobs
options.description: Number of files to process in parallel. Negative value means use number of CPUs.

options.name: --atomic
options.description: Ensures the output doesn't save if the resulting file contains syntax errors.

options.name: --interactive
options.description: Tells isort to apply changes interactively.

options.name: --format-error
options.description: Override the format used to print errors.

options.name: --format-success
options.description: Override the format used to print success.

options.name: --sort-reexports
options.description: Automatically sort all re-exports (module level __all__ collections)

options.name: --filter-files
options.description: Tells isort to filter files even when they are explicitly passed in...

options.name: --skip
options.description: Files that isort should skip over...

options.name: --extend-skip
options.description: Extends --skip to add additional files that isort should skip over.

options.name: --skip-glob
options.description: Files that isort should skip over (glob pattern).

options.name: --extend-skip-glob
options.description: Additional files that isort should skip over (extending --skip-glob).

options.name: --gitignore
options.description: Treat project as a git repository and ignore files listed in .gitignore...

options.name: --extension
options.description: Specifies what extensions isort can be run against.

options.name: --blocked-extension
options.description: Specifies what extensions isort can never be run against.

options.name: --dont-follow-links
options.description: Tells isort not to follow symlinks...

options.name: --filename
options.description: Provide the filename associated with a stream.
